pr_title: Introduce an abstract super class for aggregators.

timeline.message:
Introduce an abstract super class for aggregators.
This is to hold the boilerplate logic and get it out of the specific implementations.

timeline.bodyText: I heard once that getClass is expensive, maybe we do cache that in a constant for this.
timeline.author: bogdandrutu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,49 @@

+package io.opentelemetry.sdk.metrics.aggregator;
+
+public abstract class AbstractAggregator implements Aggregator {
+
+  @Override
+  public void mergeToAndReset(Aggregator other) {
+    if (!other.getClass().isAssignableFrom(this.getClass())) {

replies.bodyText: I am probably wrong, we need benchmarks :) later maybe
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: heh. yeah, I think getClass() is very fast, but benchmarks can show the truth.
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: also, I had this logic backwards. fixed now.
replies.author: jkwatson

timeline.bodyText: Does this need to be public?
timeline.author: bogdandrutu

If this method is called, you can assume that the passed in aggregator can be cast to your + * self-type. + * + * @param aggregator The aggregator to merge with. + */ + public abstract void doMergeAndReset(Aggregator aggregator);

timeline.bodyText: Does this need to be public?
